numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A family has a money income.
2. If a family has a higher money income, then a student from this family is more likely to be accepted into a college.
4. Some students are middle-class or lower-class.
5. Some middle-class or lower-class students try very hard.
6. Some middle-class or lower-class students are not accepted into a college because of their family income.
7. I ask whether everyone still has equal opportunity to education.
9. Financially stable students have higher chances of accessing higher education.
10. I wonder why financially stable students have higher chances of accessing higher education.
12. In my community, we are applying to colleges now.
13. I ask whether education is really fair.
